intro: Hieracium taeniarum, commonly known as the narrow-leaved hawkweed, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in meadows, grasslands, and disturbed soils, preferring full sun to partial shade. Its leaves are lance-shaped and often have a hairy texture, while its yellow flowers bloom in clusters. Hieracium taeniarum is known for its ability to thrive in a variety of soil types and its role in supporting local pollinator populations.
